title: Handbook of Hip & Knee Joint Replacement: Through the Eyes of the Patient, Surgeon & Medical Team
features: The "Handbook of Hip & Knee Joint Replacement: Through the Eyes of the Patient, Surgeon & Medical Team” is the definitive source for patients interested in joint replacement surgery.This handbook brings the subject to life for the reader by using clear, understandable language from multiple perspectives (including a surgeon, joint replacement patients, an anesthesiologist and a physical therapist).Topics covered include: when you 'need' a joint replacement, the anatomy of the knee and hip, the effects of aging on your joints, how to select a surgeon, introduction to the members of the medical team, how to prepare your home for a safe recovery, options available in anesthesia, the hospital stay, physical therapy after joint replacement, potential risks of surgery, and insurance issues... among many others. This handbook is unique in that you gain perspective from both patients and medical professionals. You are not 'lectured to' with technical medical jargon, but rather a part of the conversation. There are simply no other medical handbooks like it.You won’t be disappointed with this easily understood and informative look at the journey through joint replacement!
description: Written for ease of reading by all (especially senior citizens) because Dr. Hugate states that the theme of the handbook is to help people make tough decisions and also help loved ones and caregivers understand the issues, alternatives, and choices. The information as presented is tailored to those who most need it, tailored to the best possible outcome by strongly urging physical therapy as essentially mandatory, tailored to finding the best surgeon possible, tailored to help people prepare their homes, and especially tailored to help them know when and if the time has come for a joint replacement and what to do next. For people who have never been through total joint replacement, and perhaps even major surgery, the handbook covers these topics in perfectly focused detail.The science, procedures, and even materials of total joint replacement are under constant improvement and change as time reveals best practices. Written on purpose to avoid medical jargon, to include highly technical, date-dependent procedures and approaches, would have rendered the handbook obsolete in short order. Now in print for four years and nearing 3,000 copies sold, the handbook's quality speaks for itself.There are even cartoons because the subject matter is quite heavy and both coauthors felt that including some humor would help lighten up a very serious subject.We wish you the very best possible outcome should you choose to go embark on th life-changing journey through total joint replacement.

Dr. Hugate is Chairman of Orthopedics at Presbyterian St. Luke'sHospital in Denver Colorado.He has authored numerous scientific articlesand has also served in the in the U.S. Army Reserves, serving in both Afghanistan and Iraq. His depth of knowledge, surgical expertise, and empathy in relating to his patients makes him an unmatchable resource for patients in their journey through joint replacement. This handbook is a must-have for anyone considering hip or knee joint replacement surgery! It cuts through the fog of medical jargon and give you the wisdom and information needed in clear, understandable terms. The journey is described from beginning to end through the use of multiple perspectives: surgeon, patient, and medical team.This unique approach truly brings the subject matter to life and empower you in making the right decisions."Carol says: It was easy to read and understand. The humor is refreshing and since those reading the book are making a tough, health decision, it helps to keep life in perspective. It also reminds us to choose life, to move on and not be stuck in the pain zone. This book does not invite a mind set of negativity and I believe it will help those who read it be prepared for a successful surgery and recovery."

Coauthors: Ronald R. Hugate Jr., MD, and Robert D. Holland Dr. Ronald Hugate is the Chairman of Orthopedic Surgery at Presbyterian/Saint Luke's Medical center in Denver, Colorado. Following his undergraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering, He went on to complete surgical training in orthopedic surgery at the Penn State College of Medicine. Subsequently, he completed a two-year Fellowship at the Mayo Clinic. In 2005 he moved to Denver and joined Colorado Limb Consultants. He is currently a member of the Denver Clinic for Extremities at Risk where he specializes in joint replacement and reconstruction and the treatment of tumors involving the muscles and joints. His research interests involve advancement of joint replacement design and the treatment of bone cancers. He has published numerous scientific articles and speaks on various subjects at academic conferences. He's also a Colonel in the United States Army Reserves and has served at combat surgical hospitals in both Iraq and Afghanistan where he was awarded two Army Commendations for his service. Robert Holland, attended the University of Colorado and graduated Magna Cum Laude with a BS in Information Systems. In this capacity he performed computer, information technology (IT) consulting and owned an IT consulting company until early 2002 when he settled down for a long and fruitful employment with the State of Colorado sheriffs association where he was the Director of Information Services and IT Project Manager. He eventually earned his Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification in mid-2009. Robert writes science fiction and has been a technical writer as part of his career for many years. He has completed and published both a science fiction novel and anthology of short stories for Kindle and claims this is his best and happiest avocation. Robert is an avid bicycle rider (on the many bike trails around his home in Denver Colorado) and loves to hike in the beautiful and rugged Rocky Mountain.
